body:
I looked quite closely at implementations of `any` in boost and libc++: https://github.com/llvm-mirror/libcxx/blob/master/include/any

I think the benefit of rolling our own is that we can lose a lot of the complexity of the implementation because we don't need many of the features, such as the ability to copy/clone any values. I also didn't see any nice, standard conformant open source implementation of `std::any`
